greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Denominators of continued fraction convergents to sqrt(26).
comment: For positive n, a(n) equals the permanent of the n X n tridiagonal matrix with 10's along the main diagonal and 1's along the superdiagonal and the subdiagonal. - _John M. Campbell_, Jul 08 2011
a(n) equals the number of words of length n on alphabet {0, 1, ..., 10} avoiding runs of zeros of odd lengths. - _Milan Janjic_, Jan 28 2015
Numbers k for which m*k^2 + (-1)^k is a perfect square:
[°] apparently without related sequences in the OEIS.
link: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..200
Sergio Falcon and Ángel Plaza, On the Fibonacci k-numbers, Chaos, Solitons & Fractals 2007; 32(5): 1615-24.
Sergio Falcon and Ángel Plaza, The k-Fibonacci sequence and the Pascal 2-triangle Chaos, Solitons & Fractals 2007; 33(1): 38-49.
Sergio Falcon and Ángel Plaza, On k-Fibonacci sequences and polynomials and their derivatives, Chaos, Solitons & Fractals (2007).
M. Janjic, On Linear Recurrence Equations Arising from Compositions of Positive Integers, Journal of Integer Sequences, Vol. 18 (2015), Article 15.4.7.
Kai Wang, On k-Fibonacci Sequences And Infinite Series List of Results and Examples, 2020.
Index entries for sequences related to Chebyshev polynomials.
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (10,1).
formula: a(n) = S(n, 10*I)*(-I)^n with I^2:=-1 and S(n, x)=U(n, x/2) Chebyshev's polynomials of the second kind. See A049310.
a(n) = F(n+1, 10), the (n+1)-th Fibonacci polynomial evaluated at x=10. - _T. D. Noe_, Jan 19 2006
program: (Sage) [lucas_number1(n,10,-1) for n in range(1, 19)] # _Zerinvary Lajos_, Apr 26 2009
(MAGMA) I:=[1,10]; [n le 2 select I[n] else 10*Self(n-1) + Self(n-2): n in [1..30]]; // _G. C. Greubel_, Jan 24 2018
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
